wikipedia_page.main: Nicholas Clive Jeavons (born  (1957-11-12) 12 November 1957) is a former England international rugby union player. In 1983 he toured with the British and Irish Lions on their tour to New Zealand and at the time played club rugby for Moseley.

link_mentions.page: 1983 British Lions tour to New Zealand
response: *Nick Jeavons replaced John O'Driscoll although O'Driscoll did resume playing on the tour.

1981–82 Australia rugby union tour of Britain and Ireland
response: ENGLAND: Marcus Rose, John Carleton, Clive Woodward, Paul Dodge, Mike Slemen (rep Nick Stringer 63 min), Huw Davies, Steve Smith, Colin Smart, Peter Wheeler, Gary Pearce, Bill Beaumont (c), Maurice Colclough, Nick Jeavons, Peter Winterbottom, Bob Hesford
